item.title: use git worktree/submodule and CI to create hugo github-pages
item.description: As begin, I confused about the github-pages rules. I found git worktree/submodule are so great to keep your github-pages repo clear. You might need below type of branch or repo public data branch: git worktree (master or gh-pages) source data branch (maybe branch hugo) theme repo as git submodule Once you split your repo structure, you can add CI. Then you can just force about content and don't need to care about the public parts.
